data.question: What is the main focus of the research conducted by Byeongchan Lee, Dohyun Moon, and Jinhee Park?
data.answer: The main focus of the research is the dual postsynthetic modification (PSM) of a metal–organic framework (MOF) involving the microscopic conversion of C@H bonds into C@C bonds and the mesoscopic introduction of hierarchical porosity.

data.question: What method was used to synthesize single-crystalline Co2(m-DOBDC)?
data.answer: Single-crystalline Co2(m-DOBDC) was synthesized according to a previously reported method.

data.question: What was the effect of introducing methyl groups on water adsorption in MOFs?
data.answer: The introduction of methyl groups at the C5 position effectively reduced water adsorption at the Co2+ open metal sites.

data.question: True or False: The introduction of hydroxymethyl groups significantly enhanced water uptake at low pressures.
data.answer: True

data.question: What was the result of treating MOF crystals with formic acid solution?
data.answer: Cracks appeared in the crystallographic ab planes of both Co2(p-DOBDC) and Co2(m-DOBDC), forming highly porous mesostructures.

data.question: What was the role of Soxhlet extraction in the study of MOFs?
data.answer: Soxhlet extraction was performed to remove the coordinated halides, H3O+, and unreacted reagents before acquiring the N2 adsorption and desorption isotherms.

data.question: True or False: The dual PSM protocol was able to introduce desired functional groups into MOFs while generating highly porous mesostructures.
data.answer: True

data.question: What was the effect of the proximity of introduced functional groups to the coordination bonds?
data.answer: The proximity of the introduced functional groups to the coordination bonds lowered the stability of the coordination bonds, facilitating the transformation into hierarchically porous mesostructures.

data.question: True or False: The crystals of Co2(p-DOBDC) remained intact due to the lower reactivity and weaker coordinating ability of the longer alkyl halides.
data.answer: True

data.question: What was the observed effect on the N2 uptake at 0.1 P/P0 for Co2(5-alkyl-m-DOBDC) prepared by EAS with an alkyl halide?
data.answer: The N2 uptake at 0.1 P/P0 for Co2(5-alkyl-m-DOBDC) prepared by EAS with an alkyl halide was lower than that of the pristine Co2(m-DOBDC).

data.question: True or False: The dual PSM of Co2(m-DOBDC) during the modification enabled structural information to be obtained unambiguously.
data.answer: True

data.question: What was the effect of the reaction with CH3I on Co2(m-DOBDC)?
data.answer: The reaction with CH3I enabled single-crystal X-ray diffractometry (SXRD) to be carried out, confirming the introduction of the methyl group at the C5 position of m-DOBDC4@.

data.question: True or False: The introduction of the hydroxymethyl group was gradually converted into the methyl group, as confirmed by NMR observations.
data.answer: True

data.question: What was the effect of the introduction of mesopores on the MOFs?
data.answer: The introduction of mesopores led to the formation of hierarchical micro- and mesoporous structures, as indicated by the appearance of hysteresis in the adsorption–desorption isotherms.

data.question: True or False: The adsorption–desorption isotherms reveal that the N2 uptake at 0.95 P/P0 for Co2(5-alkyl-m-DOBDC) was the same or higher than that of pristine Co2(m-DOBDC).
data.answer: True

data.question: What was the effect of the chemisorption of methyl iodide and formaldehyde on the ligand?
data.answer: The chemisorption of methyl iodide and formaldehyde generated the same ligand, 5-methyl-m-DOBDC4@, but resulted in significantly different colors of the resulting crystals.

data.question: True or False: The proximity of sterically bulky groups to the Co@O coordination bond further reduces MOF stability.
data.answer: True
